thread.title: Tiffany Trump left red-faced after NOBODY wanted to sit by her on the front row at New York Fashion Week
thread.title_full: Tiffany Trump left red-faced after NOBODY wanted to sit by her on the front row at New York Fashion Week

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Tiffany Trump left red-faced after NOBODY wanted to sit by her on the front row at New York Fashion Week
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Tiffany Trump cut a lonely figure on the front row at New York Fashion Week. 
Donald Trump ’s daughter was reserved a prestigious place on the front row – but she found herself sitting alone. 
Fashion writer Christina Binkley took to Twitter to claim that “nobody” wanted to sit next to the controversial President’s daughter. 
And she claimed that two fashion editors actually “moved” seats to avoid being next to the 23 year old. Tiffany Trump (Photo: WireImage) 
“Nobody wants to sit next to Tiffany Trump at Philipp Plein, so they moved and the seats by her are empty,” journalist Christina Binkley tweeted. 
She also shared photos of the “empty seats next to Tiffany Trump”. 
But surprisingly, instead of laughing along at the tweets, people stood up for Tiffany and accused the writer and the people who moved seats of “bullying” her. 
And on Wednesday’s episode of The View even Whoopi Goldberg defended President Trump’s daughter. 
“You know what, Tiffany, I’m supposed to go to a couple more shows. I don’t know what’s going to happen, but I’m coming to sit with you,” she said on the show. 
“Because nobody’s talking politics. You’re looking at fashion! She doesn’t want to talk about her dad! She’s looking at the fashion!” Whoopi Goldberg defended Tiffany on The View (Photo: ITV) Tiffany Trump at fashion week (Photo: WireImage) 
Today, the designer behind the show spoke out in Tiffany's defence. 
“Tiffany Trump is not a politician, she’s a teenager,” Philipp Plein told TMZ . 
“Can you blame a daughter for having a father who has the wrong political direction for some people? 
“I’m not here to judge I just think it’s not right to treat someone without respect because she is the daughter of somebody don’t like.” Like us on Facebook
